favourite.article: Arthur S. Booth-Clibborn was the son-in-law of William Booth, the founder of the Salvation Army. He offered his services to the Army in France in 1881. He married Catherine Booth, the eldest daughter of William Booth. He left the Salvation Army in 1902 over a disagreement concerning points of doctrine and constitution. He was an extraordinary evangelist, strongly preaching repentance. He advocated a simple Christ-like life. - Songs of the Spirit by Martin The music was written by his daughter.
